critique: The document establishes the Office of Production Management within the Executive Office during a declared national emergency (1939). It outlines the office's functions, which include increasing and regulating production and supply of materials for national defense, coordinating government agencies, surveying requirements, advising on plans, ensuring raw material supply, mobilizing production facilities, determining the adequacy of facilities, and setting priorities for material deliveries. It also establishes a Priorities Board to advise on priorities and allocations, taking into account social and economic considerations. The order emphasizes executive control and coordination of resources for national defense.
